headline: How will the LA fires affect the ocean? These researchers are racing to find out
context: Scientists aboard a research ship collected ash and debris to assess wildfire pollutants

A quarterly research voyage to study the Pacific Ocean coincided with the Palisades and Eaton fires in the Los Angeles area. Samples gathered during the January trip will help scientists understand the natural disasterâ€™s effects on the ocean.

annotations.reason: This is an image credit and does not contribute to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph: The ship was more than 160 kilometers offshore when biological oceanographer Rasmus Swalethorp spotted yellow smoke billowing above Los Angeles.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides narrative progression by describing the ship's location and the observation of smoke, linking the fires to the research mission.
